question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Function: process_qty()] [Decimal Conversion] At line 91, does decimal::from(max_outflow) accurately represent u64 max_outflow, or can precision loss allow slightly exceeding the limit? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Function: process_qty()] [Rate Limit Check] Can an attacker call process_qty with qty exactly equal to (max_outflow - current_outflow), then immediately call again in the same window to exceed the limit? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Function: remaining_outflow()] [Concurrent Modification] Can remaining_outflow() return stale values if called between another transaction's update_internal() and process_qty(), misleading users about available capacity? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Function: remaining_outflow()] [Saturating Subtraction] At lines 99-102, does saturating_sub() hide negative remaining capacity, allowing queries to return zero instead of revealing over-limit conditions? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Function: remaining_outflow()] [Information Leakage] Can attackers call remaining_outflow() to precisely determine when window transitions occur and time their transactions to maximize outflow before limits apply? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Function: remaining_outflow()] [State Modification] Does remaining_outflow() being mutable (takes &mut) allow unintended state changes through update_internal() that should be read-only? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Function: update_internal()] [Edge Case] When window_duration is 1 and cur_time advances by 1, does the system correctly transition windows, or can off-by-one errors cause window skipping? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Function: current_outflow()] [Edge Case] When cur_time equals window_start exactly, does (cur_time - window_start + 1) equal 1, causing prev_weight to be maximum and incorrectly weighing old outflows? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/suilend_d/suilend/sources/rate_limiter.move] [Function: current_outflow()] [Edge Case] At the exact moment when cur_time equals window_start + window_duration - 1, does the weight calculation become zero, ignoring prev_qty entirely? (Low)
